avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted in the mountains due to the changing weather on Friday. On Saturday, snow showers are expected, and some snowfall in the mountains, but on Saturday night, it will warm up again with rain.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted in the mountains due to changing weather on Friday. On Saturday, snow showers and some snowfall are expected in the mountains, leading to wind slab formation. However, this will be short-lived, as temperatures will rise again on Saturday night with rain, likely causing further snowmelt. Snowfall is expected again on Sunday with snow showers. Older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas. On Friday night, snow showers are expected, but on Saturday, temperatures will rise across the country, with rain forecasted in most regions. Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas.  Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt laugardags kólnar og búast má við éljagangi og töluverðri snjósöfnun til fjalla. Á laugardagskvöld hlýnar aftur og rignir töluvert á svæðinu en á sunnudag kólnar með tilheyrandi éljagangi.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New wind slabs may form high in the mountains due to SW snowfall and snowdrift over the weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The area has relatively little snow. In mountains and valleys, the snowpack is old, firm, and stable, with a thin layer of softer snow on top. Alternating snow showers and rain are expected over the weekend, so most new snow should settle quickly. However, high in the mountains where temperatures remain near freezing, unstable wind slabs may form due to SW drifting.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas. On Friday night, snow showers are expected, but on Saturday, temperatures will rise across the country, with rain forecasted in most regions. Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas.  Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Um helgina er spáð alhvassri SV átt með hægari breytilegri inn á milli. Hiti sveiflast í kringum frostmark. Talsverð úrkoma, væntanlega mest éljagangur ofan við u.þ.b. 500 m hæð, en í neðri hluta hlíða skiptist á snjókoma og rigning. Úrkomuminna og hægari vindur á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Warming on Saturday will likely impact the snowpack up to higher elevations but wind slabs will likely form again during snow showers on Sunday and Monday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow is expected to melt on Saturday during warming in all elevations. Wind slabs may form on Sunday and Monday suring southerly snow showers. The older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas. On Friday night, snow showers are expected, but on Saturday, temperatures will rise across the country, with rain forecasted in most regions. Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas.  Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Éljagangur aðfaranótt laugardags en hlýnar með deginum og búist við rigningu til fjalla laugardagskvöld. Kólnar aftur á sunnudag og gert ráð fyrir éljagangi.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small loose snow avalanche released in Magnúsartindur in Oddsskarð on February 26. Several thin avalanches fell in Seldalur and Fannardalur near Norðfjörður on the morning of February 22.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The older snowpack is generally considered stable. New snow in the coming days should settle quickly or melt, except for in the highest mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The older snow is hard and stable, with little snow in lowlands. Some recent snow is present high in the mountains, where wind slabs may have formed. Over the weekend, alternating frost and thaw are expected, with occasional snow showers or rain. New wind slabs could develop high in the mountains but are expected to stabilize quickly as temperatures rise again.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas. On Friday night, snow showers are expected, but on Saturday, temperatures will rise across the country, with rain forecasted in most regions. Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted across the country, but there is still snow in the mountains in many areas.  Wet snow avalanches may occur due to the warm conditions on Saturday.

weatherForecast.highlights: S og SV áttir næstu daga þar sem skiptast frost og þýða. Fremur úrkomulítið en búist við einhvernum skúrum og éljum.
